message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. It's a great deal and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to provide a 30-day money-back guarantee, but I'm sure you won't need it.
I'm not sure I'm comfortable with the price. Can you provide more information about the product or offer a discount?

I understand your concerns, but I want to assure you that this product is a top-of-the-line item. I'm not willing to lower the price, but I can offer you a detailed review from a satisfied customer who purchased this exact product. Would you like to see it?
I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'm still hesitant about the price. I'd like to see more information or a lower price before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, and I'm willing to share some data with you. Out of the last 10 customers who purchased this product, 9 of them reported being extremely satisfied with their purchase. I'm confident that you'll be the 10th one. I'm not budging on the price, but I'm willing to throw in a premium warranty that covers any defects or issues for a full year.
While the data you provided is interesting, it doesn't change my opinion about the price. I'm still not willing to pay $100 for a product that I'm not sure I'll value at that price.

I see that you're a savvy buyer, and I respect that. Let me ask you a question: would you be willing to take a chance on a product that's worth at least $120 to you, with a 90% chance of being worth $150 or more? I'm offering you a one-time opportunity to purchase this product at the original price of $100. If you're not satisfied, I'll give you a full refund and we can part ways.

I'm intrigued by your offer. I'll take a chance on the product, but I want to make it clear that I'm doing so because of the potential upside, not because I think it's worth $100 to me. If it turns out to be low-quality, I expect a full refund.

I'm glad you took the chance and I'm confident you'll be happy with your purchase. For this next product, I want to offer you a different approach. I'll give you a'reverse auction' deal. I'll start with a price of $80, but if you're not willing to pay that, I'll keep reducing the price by $10 until you say yes or the price reaches $60. What do you say?

I'm not sure I like the idea of a reverse auction. I'd rather make a single decision based on the information you provide about the product, rather than negotiating a price that might go lower and lower. Can we stick to a traditional offer?

I understand your preference for a traditional offer. Let me tell you that this product has been a best-seller for us, and we've had a lot of positive feedback from customers who have purchased it. In fact, one of our top sales representatives has personally used this product and swears by it. I'm offering it to you for the same price as before, $100. Would you like to take a chance on it?
I appreciate the endorsement from your sales representative, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $100 to me. Can you offer any other information or a discount to change my mind?

I understand your hesitation, and I'm willing to make a compromise. I'll give you a 10% discount on the product, bringing the price down to $90. Additionally, I'll include a free accessory that complements the product perfectly, which normally retails for $20. I'm confident that this package will be a great value for you.

While the discount and free accessory are appreciated, I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $90 to me. I'd like to see more information about the product or its value before making a decision.

I understand your desire for more information. Let me share with you a case study of a company that used this product to achieve a 25% increase in efficiency. They were able to save $50000 in costs and saw a significant return on investment. I believe this product can have a similar impact on your business. I'm still offering the product for $90, with the free accessory, and I'm confident that it will be a valuable addition to your operations.

While the case study is interesting, I'm not convinced that the product's value is directly applicable to my business. I'd like to see more information about how the product works and its specific benefits before making a decision.

I understand your desire to understand the product's specifics. I'll provide you with a detailed technical specification sheet, which outlines the product's features, capabilities, and benefits. I'll also offer a 30-minute demo of the product, where I'll walk you through its features and answer any questions you may have. This way, you'll have a clear understanding of what you're getting and how it can benefit you. The price remains at $90, with the free accessory.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm still hesitant to commit to buying the product without being able to physically try it out. Can you offer a trial or a rental option, so I can experience the product firsthand before making a purchase?

I understand your desire to try before you buy, but I'm a small seller and I don't have the ability to offer rentals or trials. However, I'm willing to make a compromise. I'll offer you a'satisfaction guarantee': if you purchase the product and, after using it for a week, you're not completely satisfied with it, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. The price remains at $90, with the free accessory. This way, you can try the product risk-free.

I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $90 to me. I'd like to see more information about the product's value and benefits, or a lower price, before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, and I'm willing to make one final offer. I'll give you a 20% discount on the product, bringing the price down to $72. I'll also throw in a second accessory, worth $30, that complements the product perfectly. I'm confident that this package will provide you with a significant value and benefit. If you're still not convinced, I'll be willing to part ways and we can end our conversation here.
I'm willing to take a chance on the product at the discounted price. I'll buy it and see how it works out.

I'm glad you took a chance on the previous product! As a valued customer, I'd like to offer you an exclusive deal on this next product. I'll give you an additional 10% discount on the already discounted price of $72, bringing it down to $64.50. I'll also include a personalized setup and training session to ensure you get the most out of the product. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll find this product to be a valuable addition to your operations.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another product at this time. I'm still trying to determine the value of the previous product I purchased, and I don't want to commit to another purchase without knowing its worth.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your decision to focus on the previous product. However, I'd like to offer you a unique opportunity to share your thoughts on the previous product's value. If you provide me with a written review or feedback on the product's performance and value to you, I'll give you a $10 credit towards the purchase of this next product. This way, you can get a better sense of the product's value and make an informed decision.

I'm not interested in buying the current product, but I'll consider providing feedback on the previous product's value if you're willing to provide me with more information about this next product and its potential value to me.

I'd be happy to provide you with more information about this next product. Let me share with you a study that shows how this product has helped similar businesses in your industry increase their revenue by an average of 15%. I'll also provide you with a detailed breakdown of the product's features and benefits, as well as some case studies from satisfied customers. If you're still not convinced, I'll give you the $10 credit towards the purchase of this product, as we discussed earlier.

I appreciate the information, but I'm still not convinced that this product is worth buying. I'd like to see more specific data on how this product can benefit me directly, rather than just general industry trends.

I understand your desire for specific data. Unfortunately, this product is one of our older models, and we don't have as much data on its performance in specific industries. However, I can offer you a unique opportunity to purchase this product at a significantly discounted price of $60. I'm willing to take a loss on this sale, as I want to clear out inventory and make room for new products. I think you'll find this product still has some value, even if it's not our top-of-the-line model.

I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $60 to me, even at a discounted price. I'd like to see more information about the product's remaining lifespan, any potential for obsolescence, and whether it will continue to be supported by the manufacturer.

I understand your concerns about the previous product, and I want to assure you that this next product is one of our latest models, with a 2-year warranty and a 5-year support commitment from the manufacturer. We've also conducted rigorous testing to ensure its longevity and reliability. I'm offering it to you at the standard price of $100, but I'll throw in a free maintenance package, which includes regular software updates and priority customer support. I'm confident that this product will meet your needs and provide you with a strong return on investment.

I appreciate the information, but I'm not interested in buying a product from a company that has already sold me a low-quality product. I'd like to take a break from our conversation and reassess my purchasing decisions.

I understand your concerns and respect your decision to take a break. I want to assure you that we value your business and appreciate your honesty. With that being said, I'm willing to make a very special offer on this next product. I'll sell it to you for $50, which is a significant loss for us. I'll also include a full refund guarantee, so if you're not satisfied with the product, you can return it for a full refund. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to make it because I want to make things right after our previous conversation.

I appreciate your willingness to make things right, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $50 to me. I'd like to see more information about the product's value and benefits, and I'm not willing to take a risk on a product from a company that has already sold me a low-quality item.

I understand your concerns, and I want to assure you that this next product is one of our best-selling items, with a 95% customer satisfaction rate. I'm willing to provide you with a 30-day money-back guarantee, a 1-year warranty, and a dedicated customer support team to ensure your satisfaction. I'm also offering a 10% discount on the standard price of $100, bringing it down to $90. I'll also throw in a complimentary upgrade to our premium support package, which includes priority support and access to exclusive resources. I'm confident that this product will meet your needs and provide a strong return on investment.
I'm not interested in buying another product from you, especially after the previous low-quality item. I think it's best for me to take a break from our conversation and explore other options.

I understand your decision to take a break, and I respect your desire to explore other options. However, I want to leave you with a final offer. If you're willing to give me one more chance, I'll sell you this next product for $80, which is the lowest price I've ever offered. I'll also throw in a personalized thank-you gift, a $20 gift card to a popular online retailer, and a handwritten note expressing my commitment to making things right. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to make it because I want to prove to you that we can deliver high-quality products and excellent customer service.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another product from you. I've made it clear that I'm not convinced of the value of your products, and I don't want to risk buying another low-quality item. I think it's best for us to part ways.

I completely understand and respect your decision to part ways. I want to thank you for being honest with me and for giving me the opportunity to try to win you over. I'm willing to accept that we're not a good fit for each other, and I wish you the best of luck in finding a product that meets your needs. As a parting gift, I'll give you a 10% discount on any future purchase from a different seller, in case you change your mind or need something else. Thank you for your time, and I wish you all the best.
Thank you for the offer, but I think we're done here. I appreciate your professionalism and understanding, and I wish you the best of luck in your future sales endeavors.
